comments.author: Nupur
comments.content: I love koftas of all kinds and a kofta with leeks and eggs is very new to me. The cabbage looks so versatile- would be delicious in any wrap or sandwich.

comments.author: Chana
comments.content: This looks delicious! One of my go to weeknight vegetarian meals is soba noodles with a fried egg.

comments.author: Anne-Marie
comments.content: My farmers' market opens this weekend and I was hoping for some spring leeks (although it'll probably take three of those to equal one of yours). Now I'm REALLY hoping for them.

comments.author: Joni
comments.content: Tacos. I use all sorts of fillings, but my favorite is probably black bean tacos with a light slaw topping.

comments.author: tiffany
comments.content: Staple weeknight meal is quinoa risotto, grilled veggies, and soup made of seasonal veggies.

comments.author: Noelle (@singerinkitchen)
comments.content: WOW, this looks super tasty. I need to go to my Farmer's Market and buy some leeks ASAP!

comments.author: Lindsey
comments.content:
These look delicious!  I really appreciate that you don't rely solely on soy as a protein source for your blog... I have a soy allergy and it is so hard to find soy-free vegetarian meals online!

Favorite weeknight veggie meal (for the contest!)... seasoned black beans, diced and sauteed bell peppers and onions, and spicy broccoli slaw, wrapped up in a taco shell.  Yummy!

comments.author: Rachele
comments.content: I'm in the process of moving, so lately my favorite veggie meal is whatever is easiest.  Going by the number of times I've eaten in the past couple weeks, a baked sweet potato with baked beans is my current favorite.  Not exactly the most inspiring dinner...

comments.author: Jenn
comments.content: My favorite weeknight meal is any version of beans and greens. It is so easy to make, only requires one pot (if beans are pre-cooked), and is super versatile. I've thrown it inside a pizza roll, stuffed peppers, wraps, and my all time favorite - eaten it straight from the pan!

comments.author: wendy
comments.content: Boring & predictable my go to is salad. I have also been on a kick where I make a batch of bean "taco" filling and use it in tacos, nachos, quesidillas, buritoes etc for a quick meal..

comments.author: Rachel
comments.content: One of my easy mid-week meals is a Spanish tortilla

comments.author: Stephanie
comments.content: I love making carrot ginger soup. Easy and tasty. Homemade bread goes perfectly with it!

comments.author: Melissa C.
comments.content: Basmati rice with chickpea stew topped with cilantro, served with a bit of hot sauce

comments.author: Jodi
comments.content: I've never cooked leeks, but this looks like a great recipe for my first try.  In our house we make black bean or black-eyed pea burgers, so this would make an interesting variation.

comments.author: Marsha
comments.content: I did all 3. my fav meal is vegan pad thai

comments.author: Gayathri
comments.content: My fav week-night meal: Crispy dosa (Indian style crepe) with sambhar (lentil soup), Finish it in style with plain yogurt!

comments.author: Katie T
comments.content: One of my favorite week night vegetarian meals is wheat couscous with garbonzo beans, veggies, feta and a mustard-vinegar dressing. Quick, protein filled and lasts for lunches during the week too! Also love an easy stir-fry, sandwich and salad or quick pasta like tomato basil pasta.

comments.author: Jenni
comments.content: I love the colors, flavors and textures that come together in this! One of our fave veggie meals is a veggie burger: chipotle black bean patty with fresh guacamole, salsa and sour cream. Sometimes, we use veggie patties chopped up w/stir-fried veggies over rice to up the protein content, too.

comments.author: Theresa Cole
comments.content: roasted or sauteed veggies with a grain or pasta is my go-to meal when I don't have the time or energy to be more creative. there are so many possibilities that the DH and I don't get tired of it.

comments.author: Kay
comments.content:
I've been pondering the delicious, lightly spicy pickled red cabbage that comes with my falafel recently. I can eat huge piles of it, but never really thought about making it until just now. I can't wait! 

For a weeknight, I love poached eggs on top of things: sauteed greens with a poached egg on top and a dash of vinegar, an egg poached in spicy tomato sauce on a piece of thick toast, etc. So easy to scale up or down -- just poach another egg!

comments.author: megan
comments.content:
I really enjoyed the recipe with grits, an egg, and the fried leeks- I've made it several times already. 

Maybe this recipe will convince me to use my leeks for something new :)

comments.author: Lynda
comments.content: My newest favorite meal is either a spicy bean soup using re-fried beans, black beans, Mexican spices and veggie broth or another new favorite is bean chalupas where I use re-fried beans, mixed with garlic, bell peppers, sauteed onions and hot enchilada sauce + Mexican spices on a crisp fried corn tortilla, with homemade guacamole, lettuce and tomatoes. YUM!

comments.author: Becca @ Amuse Your Bouche
comments.content: Leek fritters sound amazing! And I love the idea of wrapping them in a pita bread.

comments.author: Matt
comments.content:
Sounds like this will be on the menu this week!  My last night's dinner was tofu bahn mi with smoked onion jam (smoked onion idea poached from your frijoles recipe).

Love all the recipes, thanks for the great eats!

comments.author: John
comments.content:
These look great. You can't go too wrong with leeks and oil. :)

Current favorite basic dinner: a curried potato and cauliflower with nigella seeds prominent in the mix, a dal made in the pressure cooker with misc veggies, and (if I'm feeling adventurous) some curried okra as well. It's not hard to have all three of these done in about a half-hour.

But as Spring approaches, I think that your mango salad, some kind of tofu stir-fry, and baby zucchini/squash sliced lengthwise and fried in olive oil, finished with some lemon juice that can kind of caramelize on them...THAT might move to the head of the list.

comments.author: Debbie
comments.content: Not a vegetarian but I love reading all your recipes, I try to go meatless atleast once a week.

comments.author: Anne Campbell
comments.content:
I love kofta, and Middle Eastern food in general, so I'm definitely going to try these leek ones. 

Pasta + veggie + cheese has always been my staple weeknight combination, but lately my husband has gone more low-carb, so I'm trying to find "flexitarian" options that I can eat with a pasta/rice/grain and he can eat with chicken or fish. Not to suck up or anything....but recently we've had your VERY addictive Sicilian cauliflower dish, with pasta for me and fish for my husband; and last night I made your coconut rice with stir-fried green beans, fresh mint, chile peppers, and fried shallots (he had chicken with the green beans).

comments.author: Chelsea
comments.content:
Hi! These look amazing! Can't wait to add them to my recipe book. :)

My favorite weeknight comfort food is Whole Wheat Pasta with blanched zucchini, asparagus, and brussels sprouts topped with a little salt and pepper and a poached egg! mmm.....

comments.author: Sonia Chawdhary
comments.content: Can't wait to get my hands on a signed copy of your book! If I don't win the raffle, I'm going to be in Seattle in June and would love to bring my own book to have you sign it! Yes, just a tad bit obsessed! :)

comments.author: Monica
comments.content: What kind of harissa do you use?

comments.author: Hester
comments.content: I tested this recipe!! It was great!!

comments.author: soula
comments.content: Favorite weeknight comfort food....hmmm....if we are talking COMFORT food...it'd be pasta with peas, mushrooms, sundried tomatoes, and parsley in a light cream sauce. yum.

comments.author: melyssa
comments.content: my favorite weeknight meal is veggie fajitas with fresh home-made pico de gallo! yum....just can't beat the combination of sweet peppers, fresh tomatoes,onions and cilantro....love it.

comments.author: Jessi Peterson
comments.content:
I'm going to try this out on my family the next time my sister comes to visit - she's a vegetarian, while my husband and I are more flex-i-tarian.  He loves gyros, she does not, so this seems like a good compromise.

My favorite comfort food right now is asparagus.  I like it roasted in a little olive oil with balsamic vinegar drizzled on it.  And leftovers (ha!) made into cream of asparagus soup!

comments.author: Kathleen
comments.content: My favorite weeknight vegetarian meal is roasted vegetable enchiladas, homemade pizza or simple tacos with YOUR guacamole recipe.

comments.author: Mariah
comments.content: My favorite fast vegetarian weeknight meal is a quinoa risotto! Quinoa is great because it never gets too mushy and cooks fairly quickly. Throw in loads of chopped up veggies and a little bit of goat cheese (if non-vegan), and it's a healthy, high-protein meal in half an hour or so!

comments.author: Mae
comments.content: I am a new vegetarian and I just started reading your blog. I really like the topics and recipes I've seen so far and enjoy your writing style. Thank you!!

comments.author: Karen
comments.content: Favourite weeknight meal would have to be this Vietnamese noodle dish that I make with lots of fresh herbs, roasted peanuts and egg quickly cooked with sesame oil.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: I've used Mustapha's before, but it seems like they might be out of production. Try this one from Zamouri: http://www.amazon.com/dp/B004AQDCPA/?tag=poeticlicen07-20

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: It was so cool to have you and everyone else help with the "beta testing" on these recipes. Thanks again!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Thanks, Sonia! Also check out https://herbivoracious.com/upcoming-events - maybe I'm coming to your city? If so I'd love to meet you.

comments.author: eldan
comments.content:
When I saw the headline, my first reaction was "Doesn't he mean 'köfte' and 'pırasa'?" (the Turkish names for the same things).  Then my wife emailed me this news story:

http://www.theatlantic.com/international/archive/2012/04/the-white-house-dessert-that-sparked-a-minor-turkish-greek-conflict/255439/

which reminded me how ridiculous I was being.

comments.author: eldan
comments.content: As for favourite weeknight vegetarian meals, it would have to be one of a hundred variations on slow cooker beans, served with rice or sopes.  Cheap, delicious, easy, healthy and I can set it up before leaving the house in the morning, ready to eat the moment we get home.

comments.author: Elana @ The Inventive Vegetarian
comments.content:
Mmmmm, this looks so good!  I actually LOVE cabbage (one of the hazards of having a Hungarian mother, apparently), so this is totally something I'm going to have to try!

My go-to vegetarian meal is probably a grilled portobello "burger" (marinated in oil, garlic, and balsamic vinegar) on a sandwich with fresh mozzarella and avocado.  Delicious!

comments.author: Hanna
comments.content: The easiest, vegetarian meal that I tend to eat has to be a bowl of soba noodles. Along with some chopped kimchi, I'll toss the noodles with a splash of kimchi juice, a bit of sugar, and a drizzle of sesame oil. If available, I'll add some chopped tofu pieces and scallions. Yum and yum!

comments.author: Kanchan
comments.content: The marinated cabbage looks delicious, and I love koftas as you have mentioned these are quite common in indian curries, but your version of leeks and eggs is quite new. Will surely give it a try.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Ok, that's hilarious!

comments.author: Emma
comments.content: I love your Peppery Red Wine Capellini!

comments.author: Alec Lemaire
comments.content: My favourite weekday meal is omelettes with some fresh bread. It's a quick and easy, yet nutritious, way to feel good after a day at work. It's great that you can change up the ingredients each night! Since I work quite late, having a relatively lighter meal is nice as it doesn't leave me feeling to full before going to bed.

comments.author: Caitlin Allan
comments.content: My favourite vegetarian week night food is Indian curry! The simmering spices and vegetables certainly helps me unwind after a busy day. It's also great because you can put it in a tupperware for lunch the next day!

comments.author: Charlene
comments.content: My favorite vegetarian  meal is a falafel sandwich. Looking forward to your book for additional ideas

comments.author: Jana
comments.content: i love to make a couscous salad cos it's quick and easy and you can put in whatever you have in the fridge. my fave combo is roasted fennel, tofu, sundried tomatoes and raisins :P

comments.author: Donna
comments.content: oh man. the spicy pickled cabbage alone seems like it would be delicious with so many things!!

comments.author: amee
comments.content: So um I need to move to Seattle to be a Beta tester!!  :)  I really love leeks and street food so this is going on my pinterest list.  I always admire the range and diversity of your palate/dishes.  No vegetable feels left out in your kitchen!  :)

comments.author: Rini
comments.content: As I have been a vegetarian for all of my life... I guess I have to figure out what my favorite food is, EVERYTHING! I have to say though, khichadi (mung beans & rice), roti & veggie curries, Sandwiches  & Soups!

comments.author: Bonnie
comments.content: My favorite week night meal is pasta with pesto.  I blend basil, garlic, pine nuts, salt and Parmesan in the mini blender until crumbly and then top the pasta with the pesto mix and cherry tomatoes cut in half and then shave a bit more of the Parmesan on top. Good to Go!

comments.author: Liz
comments.content: Favorite weeknight meal is bean burritos.

comments.author: Kaitlin
comments.content: Avocado, black bean, and sweet potato tacos with a side of coconut rice and tostones (fried plantain medallions). Add a little bit of spice from a favorite salsa and it's a real winner!

comments.author: Jessica
comments.content: Baked tofu and roasted veggies

comments.author: Victoria
comments.content: I love Collard Wraps with falafel!

comments.author: indigo
comments.content: This time of year I like a veggie matzo ball soup with lots of chard in it.

comments.author: s
comments.content: Pasta with lots of veggies.

comments.author: Lisa @ Snappy Gourmet
comments.content: Your cookbook looks beautiful!

comments.author: y
comments.content: My favorite week night meal is roasted veggies with some delicious sauce, bread and fried tofu.

comments.author: Jimish
comments.content: A quick meal adapted from Mark Bitman's receipe: brocoli rabe, garlic, vegan sausage, and red seedless grapes warmed in a skillet

comments.author: Brandon
comments.content: Leek patties... never would have thought of that.  Every recipe increases the value of my CSA box!  Can't wait for the cookbook!

comments.author: Dennis
comments.content: I'm from the south so I really have to check out those collard wraps.

comments.author: Craig
comments.content: My favorite vegetarian dinner is a bowl of cereal.  I don't have a lot of time.  These recipes are helping.

comments.author: Melanie
comments.content: looks delicious! i'm going to put my homemade sauerkraut in it!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: We have a winner, and it is Melyssa. Thanks, everyone!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Thanks for entering, everybody! Melyssa, above, won the signed book.

comments.author: Northwest Herbivore
comments.content: These look like something I'd like to try to veganize (though they might have to get in line behind several other of your recipes that I've marked!). What consistency should I aim for in the batter and in the finished patties?

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Leeks a pre-sauteed. Batter should be thick enough to form patties, and finished kouftike should be lighter than, say, falafel.

comments.author: laura winikow
comments.content: These remind me of my favorite Sephardic Passover dish:  keftes de prasa.  My family is from the Isle of Rhodes (first when it was occupied by Turkey and also later under Italian rule before WW2) and this was a particular favorite....never occurred to me to put it into a sandwich.  Wow and thank you for a great idea.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Yep, the exact same thing! Keftes, kouftikes, people just have idiosyncratic ways of calling them. We always have them at Passover as well (with matzoh flour of course).
